snippet.textDisplay: I’ll keep saying it, the PvP in this game is poorly thought out and obviously a last minute add on for the replayability factor. There is far too much benefit for rats with free loadouts to say friendly then mag dump you. Either a team up option or increasing the raider health against raider weapons would do amazing to combat the negatives about the PvP. It would be much easier to either escape or fight back against the low skilled free loadout rats. Currently I only go into Stella with a free loadout and make it out most of my matches because most of the weapons I am given can perform really well against raiders.

snippet.textDisplay:
I played Arc Raiders like a saint for a full week. Never ONCE hurt another fellow raider.

Robbed and killed about 50-100 times. I had enough. 

Calmly went back to Speranza, Loaded two shotguns and full of ammo. Full shield.

Started a game and ran to last extraction point on map and sat in the underground train station shadows. 

Finally left the game with a tonne of loot after leaving bodies all over the platform. 

Didn't want to do it. But unfortunately I had lost my mind. 

Apologies to the dead, but this game needs some sort of punishment system in place. 

The few good games with good raiders was unforgettable. 

Great memories. Thank you. 

From a chill dad who wants wants to chill after a day's work.  Peace.

snippet.textDisplay:
This was my first extraction shooter, and it might be the last. From all the good things I've heard about the game, I figured this must be more casual an open/approachable than others, but that doesn't seem to be the case.
So far I've been able to extract twice by sheer luck, and every other time I'm either spawn camp or elevator camp sniped, every time, consistently.

Not sure if it's more of a matchmaking issue, where it'd make more sense to put us noobs (and casuals) in the same game, and all the sweaty grinders and campers in another.
All in all, I guess extraction shooters are only for people who _really_ like multiplayer FPS, the Counter-Strike players basically, which narrows down the player base a lot imo.

snippet.textDisplay:
I must be getting old or just too casual or something. Just opening up the inventory makes my heart sink. I don't want another job, but a fun - even if quite tense at times - game to enjoy after work. I don't want to spend minutes thinking about what gear to even start a mission with. Don't want to care about gear durability, about various ways of correctly marking blueprints or items for tracking etc. I was hoping for a game with great environment, fun player interactions and as little need for micromanagement as possible.
Happy that so many people enjoy this but I have to accept it's not for me.

snippet.textDisplay: there's already hundreds of comments so i feel like i can say this without giving away a big secret. the hairpin is extremely underrated. it will 2-shot down most of the time, and it's extremely quiet. and while it's not great against ARC, if you shoot them from far away enough, they will have a hard time locating you. also, be careful what you recycle/sell because a lot of weird items are needed to upgrade stations and/or complete missions.

snippet.textDisplay:
No matter who says what, if there is no base building or an explorable base of operation in an extraction shooter, then there's no actual fun in investing 100 of hours into it.

The underground Speranza is not explorable & roam-able at all. Its just a still image WTF!
I will admit that Graphics, Environment & Soundtrack is 10/10 without any doubt.
But there's no meaning to grind in this **baseless** desert & abandoned city. Come on!

I can adapt with the all time pvp threat because doing stealth & camping is **sometimes** super fun.

But no Base of Operations! 
No Base Buiding!
Not even a Safe House!

Overall 0/0.

Doesn’t make sense, and my second problem is with Speranza it’s self… I would love it to be an actual visited place, visit other players rooms and see players walking about , like some sort of social place we can get together , I hope one day they make Speranza a real place we can all meet up and visit

snippet.textDisplay:
Remember when this was supposed to be a cool co-op PVE game about fighting giant robots? Yeah, me too. What we got instead is the most soulless, trend-chasing "bait-and-switch" of the year. They completely ripped out the game's identity to make a bad Tarkov clone.

The gameplay loop is just: 1) Run through an empty map for 10 minutes. 2) Get one-tapped by a player camping in a bush you couldn't even see. 3) Lose all your stuff. 4) Repeat. The AI is either braindead or an aimbot. It's not "tense," it's just boring. And what's the reward for this "fun"? A garbage battle pass and some of the most aggressive monetization I've seen.

And before anyone hits reply:

No, it's not an "Alpha" or "Beta." The game is out. This isn't a "work in progress" that will get better; this is the finished product they're charging for.

No, it's not a "skill issue." This has nothing to do with "getting good." My "skill" doesn't fix the empty maps, the terrible AI, or the fact that the entire meta is just camping. It's not hard; it's tedious and disrespectful of your time.

And yes, the graphics are "amazing," but who cares? A pretty-looking empty box is still an empty box. It's all style and absolutely zero substance.

Honestly, it's the complete opposite of a game like Concord. Everyone who didn't play Concord trashed it from the start, and now it's canceled. But those of us who actually played it found a super fun 5v5 game with unique ideas, cool lore, and a great model where you could earn everything in-game. Arc Raiders is a game that looks good to outsiders, but those of us who are playing it are the ones telling you it's a hollow, cynical cash-grab.

Finally, I don't want to hear about their "10-year plan." That's just marketing talk. Anthem had a 10-year plan, too. That's not a real promise, and they will drop support in a month flat when the player count inevitably dies off.

Don't waste your time or money. This is just a hollow ghost of a game that should have been canceled.

snippet.textDisplay: This game is not for everyone. You will be facing off against other players as well as NPC enemies all trying to kill you while u are trying to get loot and extract before the timer runs out. If you die you can/will be looted and lose all your stuff. Yes that means ALL as in even the stuff you started your run with not just the stuff u looted. Its not like Division/Divisions 2 dark zone where you only lose contaminated gear. Here you lose all and start back at zero and will have to buy/craft more gear to do another run. Now imagine having legendary gear you got from a good run or something you crafted with rare items. You go for a run then you die and lose all of it. Not going to be fun. Gonna have a lot of grieving in this game. For every player that has a great run and looted rare stuff. There will be losers that lost it all.
